item.title: ::starter
item.dc:creator: @Helbound Helbound
item.description:
@Helbound wrote:

[quote=“owned654321241, post:16, topic:156492”]i got it down to:

client.java:8077: cannot find symbol symbol : variable messageToAdmins location: class PlayerHandler PlayerHandler.messageToAdmins = (playerName +" Has tried to cheat by getting two starter kits!"); ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .[/quote]
Lol, then just remove the-

PlayerHandler.messageToAdmins = (playerName +" Has tried to cheat by getting two starter kits!");
From-

PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName + " Has tried to cheat by getting two starters!!"); PlayerHandler.messageToAdmins = (playerName +" Has tried to cheat by getting two starter kits!"); txt4 = "I'm Cheating! KILL ME!";
So it should look like this-

PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName + " Has tried to cheat by getting two starters!!"); txt4 = "I'm Cheating! KILL ME!";
Lol.

Read full topic

item.title: ::starter
item.dc:creator: @rs_w00dcut rs w00dcut
item.description:
@rs_w00dcut wrote:

Here:

[code]if (command.startsWith(“starter”)){
if(kitstarter >= 1)
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName + " Is a greedy twat who got a blackmark");

BufferedWriter bw = null;
try {
bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(“logs/blackmarks.txt”, true));
bw.write(playerName+" Tryed to Cheat, black mark! ");
bw.newLine();
bw.flush();
blackmark +=1;
} catch (IOException ioe) {
ioe.printStackTrace();
} finally {
if (bw != null) try {
bw.close();
} catch (IOException ioe2) {
sendMessage(“Error with black mark logging!”);
}
}

}
else if(kitstarter <= 0){

kitstarter +=1;
BufferedWriter bw = null;

PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName + " Got their starter kit get your’s by typing ::starter");
addItem(995,200000000);
addItem(6583,1);
addItem(1053,1);
addItem(1055,1);
addItem(1057,1);
addItem(3140,1);
try {
bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(“logs/starters.txt”, true));
bw.write(playerName+" Got their starter pack ");
bw.newLine();
bw.flush();
} catch (IOException ioe) {
ioe.printStackTrace();
} finally {
if (bw != null) try {
bw.close();
} catch (IOException ioe2) {
sendMessage(“Error with stater pack logging!”);
}
}
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: ::starter
item.dc:creator: @Helbound Helbound
item.description:
@Helbound wrote:

Ok, here-

Step 1
Right beneath-

public class client extends Player implements Runnable {

Add this-

public static int starter = 0;

Then Find-

} else if (token.equals("character-hasegg")) { hasegg = Integer.parseInt(token2);
And right beneath the-

hasegg = Integer.parseInt(token2);

Add this-

} else if (token.equals("character-starter")) { hasegg = Integer.parseInt(token2);
Then find-

characterfile.write("character-hasegg = ", 0, 19); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(hasegg), 0, Integer.toString(hasegg).length()); characterfile.newLine();
And right beneath the-

characterfile.newLine();

add this-

characterfile.write("character-starter = ", 0, 19); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(starter), 0, Integer.toString(starter).length()); characterfile.newLine();
Now find-

command.trim();

And the coding around it should look something like this-

command.replaceAll("no-ip", "imgay"); command.replaceAll("servegame", "imgay"); command.trim();
If it does, add this-

[code]if (command.startsWith(“starter”)){
if (starter == 1)
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName + " Has tried to cheat by getting two starters!!");
PlayerHandler.messageToAdmins = (playerName +" Has tried to cheat by getting two starter kits!");
txt4 = “I’m Cheating! KILL ME!”;
sendMessage(“Cheater”);
sendMessage(“CHeater”);

BufferedWriter bw = null;
try {
bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(“logs/cheaters.txt”, true));
bw.write(playerName+" Tried to cheat their way into getting two starters!");
bw.newLine();
bw.flush();
} catch (IOException ioe) {
ioe.printStackTrace();
} finally {
if (bw != null) try {
bw.close();
} catch (IOException ioe2) {
sendMessage(“Error with cheat logging!”);
}
}

}
else if (starter == 0){

starter +=1;
BufferedWriter bw = null;

PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName + " Got their starter kit get your’s by typing ::starter");
addItem(995,200000000);
addItem(6583,1);
addItem(1053,1);
addItem(1055,1);
addItem(1057,1);
addItem(3140,1);
try {
bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(“logs/starterkits.txt”, true));
bw.write(playerName+" Got their starter kit!");
bw.newLine();
bw.flush();
} catch (IOException ioe) {
ioe.printStackTrace();
} finally {
if (bw != null) try {
bw.close();
} catch (IOException ioe2) {
sendMessage(“Error with stater kit logging!”);
}
}[/code]

If it doesn’t work,pm me, or tell me here.[br][size=1]Posted on: November 03, 2007, 10:56:28 AM[/size][hr][quote=“cwg452003, post:13, topic:156492”]Then this is your own fault! Change your first post, ask for everything, because you said you already added everything else, but you obviously didn’t if it doesn’t know the variable starterkit or kitstarter.[/quote] Lets see if mine works. I posted EXACTLY how to do it. and its of my own creation. Although the items I just took from someone else who posted here, lol.

Read full topic

item.title: ::starter
item.dc:creator: @musicmad441 Musicmad
item.description:
@musicmad441 wrote:

Ok this:

[code]if (command.startsWith(“starter”)){
if (starterKit == 1)
{
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName + " Has tried to has tried to get 2 starters!");

BufferedWriter bw = null;
try {
bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(“logs/blackmarks.txt”, true));
bw.write(playerName+" Tryed to Cheat, black mark! ");
bw.newLine();
bw.flush();
blackmark +=1;
} catch (IOException ioe) {
ioe.printStackTrace();
} finally {
if (bw != null) try {
bw.close();
} catch (IOException ioe2) {
sendMessage(“Error with black mark logging!”);
}
}

}
else if (starterKit == 0){

kitstarter +=1;
BufferedWriter bw = null;

PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (playerName + " Got their starter kit get your’s by typing ::starter");
addItem(995,200000000);
addItem(6583,1);
addItem(1053,1);
addItem(1055,1);
addItem(1057,1);
addItem(3140,1);
try {
bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(“logs/starters.txt”, true));
bw.write(playerName+" Got their starter pack ");
bw.newLine();
bw.flush();
} catch (IOException ioe) {
ioe.printStackTrace();
} finally {
if (bw != null) try {
bw.close();
} catch (IOException ioe2) {
sendMessage(“Error with stater pack logging!”);
}
}[/code]

And at the bottom of the command, make sure you don’t have this:

} } } };

You only need:

}
}

Read full topic
